result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony L. Votis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tony L. Votis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tony L. Votis was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tony L. Votis was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tony L. Votis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant may not have any contact with Jacob Ascenbrenner or John Aschenbrenner.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Undecided

Defendant Tony L. Votis in court with attorney Timothy B Melms who appears by John Hogan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:35 AM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response or VIS or request for restitution - defendant will plead g/nc to counts #3, #4 and #5 as alleged, dismiss count #1 outright and DRI count #2 - DRI; on counts #3, #4 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #3 - court costs only, #4 - $500.00 fine plus costs and 30 days conditional jail, #5 - court costs only, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no contact with John or Jacob Aschenbrenner. Hogan and Votis agree. Court dismisses count #1 and dismisses and reads in count #2. Votis pleads NC to counts #3, #4 and #5. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Hogan makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - ready to report to jail today - requests huber - 1 day jail credit - requests 60 days to pay fines/costs. Votis makes statement, apologizes and remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #3, #4 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with following conditions: count #3 - court costs only - to be paid within first 6 months of probation, #4 - $500.00 fine plus costs - to be paid within first 6 months of probation, 30 days conditional jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service - report today - 1 day credit only if revoked, #5 - court costs only - to be paid within first 6 months of probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, no contact with John or Jacob Aschenbrenner, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Tony L. Votis in court with attorney Jennifer A. Stuber whom is appearing specially for Timothy B. Melms.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:41 PM. Stuber indicates there is a resolution and would like to set a PLEAS for different date. State indicates wanted to adjourn to companion case. Stuber and Votis make statement.  Court will adjourn this time but no further adjournments will be accepted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Final pre-trial on July 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Tony L. Votis in court with attorney Timothy B Melms - who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:34 PM. Melms states that the matter is not resolved - has gone over Fry with the defendant with some degree, have received offer from the State. Court instructs the defendant that the plea offer from the State is now off the table and Court does not have to accept any additional plea offers. State puts offer on the record, plead to counts #3, #4 and #5, recommendattion of 2 years probation on all three counts with general conditions of probation with additional condition of: 60 days conditional jail on #4 and a fine of $500.00 plus costs on one of the counts. Votis makes statement, needed more time to discuss the offer with his client. Melms states that he has not had a chance to discuss a counter-offer with the State. Court replies. State - plea offer was sent out on 6/10/16. Court will allow one more adjournment, continues bond, sets the matter for FPT. Courts advises Melms to go thru Frye collaquey with the defendant if he does not accept the offer.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
State's
Final pre-trial on June 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Tony L. Votis in court with attorney Timothy B Melms.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:52 AM. Also called 16CF59. Court has waiver of PH, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Court sets this matter for ARGN. State files Information on 16CF60 that mirrors the complaint. Dillon Votis also wavies right to PH, Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Melms and Cirilli have Informations, waives reading, both enters NG pleas to all counts, set all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
